fields.eventName: Decoding Time  A Journey into TIME SERIES ANALYSIS
fields.shortDescription: This workshop provides a gentle intro on the applications which requires time series analysis and hands-on session on - Introduction to time-series and stationary data handling, data smoothing, autocorrelation, and AutoRegressive Integrated Moving Average (ARIMA) models and handling the Temporal data imbalance in Python,
fields.longDescription: This workshop provides a gentle intro on the applications which requires time series analysis and hands-on session on - Introduction to time-series and stationary data handling, data smoothing, autocorrelation, and AutoRegressive Integrated Moving Average (ARIMA) models and handling the Temporal data imbalance in Python,

fields.shortDescription: Participants build standout personal portfolio websites using AI tools and coding. Projects are judged on design, functionality, responsiveness, and presentation. Attendees gain skills to create impressive, professional portfolios from scratch.
fields.longDescription: A dynamic workshop and contest where you build standout personal portfolio websites fast. Learn to harness AI tools and code from scratch to create portfolios that grab attention. Projects will be judged on design, functionality, responsiveness, and presentation. Attendees will gain walkaway with the ability to build impressive portfolios.

fields.shortDescription: Workshop on innovation and IPR with a hackathon. Sessions include: innovation introduction, IPR basics, ideation, creative problem-solving, group hackathon activity, and presentations. Participants learn to implement ideas effectively.
fields.longDescription:
Objective:
• To educate students about intellectual property rights (IPR) and their role in innovation.
• To inspire students to generate creative solutions to real-world problems.
• To provide a platform where students can implement their ideas through a hackathon - Group activity

Tentative Sessions:

Session 1: Introduction to Innovation (FN session)

Session 2: Understanding intellectual property rights (IPR) (FN session)

Session 3: Ideation & Creativity (FN session)

Session 4: Hackathon - Group activity - Creative solutions to real-world problems (FN & AN session)

Session 5: Presentation (AN session)

fields.shortDescription: A genAI workshop featuring a session by ManageEngine (Zoho) on AI in security, followed by a hands-on session where students explore genAI for general and industry use cases, including MCP server creation.
fields.longDescription: A GenAI workshop featuring an interactive session by industry experts from ManageEngine (Zoho) on GenAI in security domains, followed by a hands-on session by students exploring general applications, industry use cases, and MCP server creation.

fields.shortDescription: A multidisciplinary hackathon where every project integrates web development, AI/ML, cybersecurity, and product innovation. Teams build cohesive, user-centered solutions, blending technical skills, data intelligence, and innovative system design.
fields.longDescription:
HackThrone is a high-impact, multidisciplinary hackathon where participants go beyond traditional domain silos. Unlike regular hackathons that focus on a single track or theme, every project at HackThrone must integrate four critical pillars of modern technology:

1. Web Development 2. Artificial Intelligence & Machine Learning (AI/ML) 3. Cybersecurity 4. Innovation & Product Thinking This format challenges teams to think holistically, blending technical skill, system design, data intelligence, and user-centered innovation into one cohesive solution. By creating a hackathon where every team must incorporate all four core domains, not just pick one or two, HackThrone truly stands out from traditional hackathons.

fields.eventName: Quantum Meets AI The Rise of Quantum Deep Learning
fields.shortDescription: Explore quantum computing principles like superposition and entanglement to accelerate deep learning. Learn hybrid algorithms, quantum-inspired neural networks, and see hands-on demos highlighting future AI applications.
fields.longDescription: This workshop explores how quantum computing principles, such as superposition and entanglement, can accelerate and transform deep learning models. Participants will learn about quantum-inspired neural networks, hybrid quantum-classical algorithms, and their potential in solving complex problems. Hands-on demonstrations and case studies will highlight the future of quantum-enhanced AI applications.

fields.shortDescription: Participants act as digital detectives in a CTF-style murder mystery. They uncover hidden clues, solve technical puzzles, and piece together evidence under time pressure, combining investigation, problem-solving, and teamwork.
fields.longDescription: Participants will step into the role of digital detectives in this thrilling capture-the-flag challenge, where they must unravel a gripping murder mystery by uncovering hidden clues, solving technical puzzles, and piecing together evidence. The event blends problem-solving, investigation, and teamwork under time pressure, offering an engaging and competitive experience for beginners and enthusiasts alike.

fields.shortDescription: Creative hackathon to generate and refine AI prompts for tools like ChatGPT, DALL·E, or Midjourney. Participants brainstorm, test, and optimize prompts across coding, design, storytelling, business, or analytics projects.
fields.longDescription:
A Prompt-a-thon is a creative, hackathon-style event focused on generating and refining AI prompts to get the most effective, accurate, or innovative outputs from AI tools like ChatGPT, DALL·E, or Midjourney.
Participants brainstorm, design, and test prompts across different domains—like coding, design, storytelling, business solutions, or data analytics—to solve real-world problems or create cool, out-of-the-box projects.

fields.eventName: Prompt Wars AI Image Challenge Solo
fields.shortDescription: Participants will see an AI-generated image made by the club and must craft the most accurate prompt using an AI image generation tool to recreate it. The participant whose output best matches the original image will be declared the winner.
fields.longDescription: Participants will be shown an AI-generated image created by the club. Their task is to craft the most accurate prompt using an AI image generation tool to recreate the image as closely as possible.The participant whose output most closely matches the original image will be declared the winner

fields.eventName: Prompt Wars AI Image Challenge Duo
fields.shortDescription: Participants will see an AI-generated image made by the club and must craft the most accurate prompt using an AI image generation tool to recreate it. The participant whose output best matches the original image will be declared the winner.
fields.longDescription: Participants will be shown an AI-generated image created by the club. Their task is to craft the most accurate prompt using an AI image generation tool to recreate the image as closely as possible.The participant whose output most closely matches the original image will be declared the winner

fields.shortDescription: Experience the future of power! This workshop and Make-a-Thon will guide you through designing air-cored coupled inductors to achieve electricity transfer through air. Learn the science, build your own prototypes, and compete with peers in creating innovative wireless power solutions. Gen Z innovation meets real-world energy transfer!
fields.longDescription: Experience the future of power! This workshop and Make-a-Thon will guide you through designing air-cored coupled inductors to achieve electricity transfer through air. Learn the science, build your own prototypes, and compete with peers in creating innovative wireless power solutions. Gen Z innovation meets real-world energy transfer!

fields.eventName: Neural Strokes AI for Cultural Creativity Duo
fields.shortDescription: Neural Strokes: AI for Cultural Creativity explores the intersection of tradition and technology, where artificial intelligence reimagines cultural drawings and heritage art forms.
fields.longDescription: Neural Strokes: AI for Cultural Creativity explores the intersection of tradition and technology, where artificial intelligence reimagines cultural drawings and heritage art forms.

fields.eventName: Neural Strokes AI for Cultural Creativity Solo
fields.shortDescription: Neural Strokes: AI for Cultural Creativity explores the intersection of tradition and technology, where artificial intelligence reimagines cultural drawings and heritage art forms.
fields.longDescription: Neural Strokes: AI for Cultural Creativity explores the intersection of tradition and technology, where artificial intelligence reimagines cultural drawings and heritage art forms.

fields.shortDescription: Students will be given series of problem statements to be solved only by MATLAB and SIMULINK.
fields.longDescription: Students will be given series of problem statements to be solved only by MATLAB and SIMULINK.

fields.eventName: Innovation Technology protection of Human values
fields.shortDescription: Multidisciplinary Workshop on protection of Human values
fields.longDescription: Multidisciplinary Workshop on protection of Human values

fields.shortDescription: Teams design compact rovers and compete in mobility and manipulation trials over rough terrain. Judging includes time, accuracy, efficiency, robustness, innovation, and safety, with bonuses for autonomous performance.
fields.longDescription: Pravahan 1.0 is VIT Chennai’s flagship national robotics competition, inviting student teams of 2–4 members to design compact rovers within 30 × 30 × 40 cm (l*b*h). The event is structured in three stages: Stage 1 – Ideation (online submission of concept report), Stage 2 – Proof of Concept (structured report + video demonstration), and Stage 3 – On-Site Finals at VIT Chennai. In the Finals, teams compete in two trials: (i) Mobility Trial – obstacle avoidance and checkpoint navigation across terrains with sand, mud, stones, uneven paths, humps, and sharp turns, and (ii) Manipulation Trial – precise pick-and-place of colored blocks at different heights under terrain difficulties. Judging will be based on time, accuracy, efficiency, robustness, innovation, and safety, with bonus recognition for autonomous mobility. As part of TechnoVIT, Pravahan 1.0 offers a national platform for showcasing innovation, applied engineering, and teamwork, supported by prizes, patent assistance, and industry exposure.

fields.eventName: Breaking Point A Structural Engineering Showdown
fields.shortDescription: Put your engineering instincts to the test in this hands-on structural challenge! In Breaking Point: A Structural Engineering showdown, teams will design and construct bridge or boom structures using simple materials like popsicle sticks or straws. Each structure will be judged on three key criteria: Strength-to-weight ratio Design creativity Structural performance under load Once built, the real test begins — bridges will be load tested until failure to determine which designs truly hold up under pressure. This is more than a contest; it’s a chance to apply engineering principles, think creatively under constraints, and experience the thrill of designing something that just might outperform the rest. Can your structure take the pressure, or will it hit its breaking point?
fields.longDescription:
Put your engineering instincts to the test in this hands-on structural challenge! In Breaking Point: A Structural Engineering showdown, teams will design and construct bridge or boom structures using simple materials like popsicle sticks or straws.

Each structure will be judged on three key criteria:

Strength-to-weight ratio
Design creativity
Structural performance under load

Once built, the real test begins — bridges will be load tested until failure to determine which designs truly hold up under pressure.

This is more than a contest; it’s a chance to apply engineering principles, think creatively under constraints, and experience the thrill of designing something that just might outperform the rest.

Can your structure take the pressure, or will it hit its breaking point?

fields.eventName: Global Goals, Local Code An Innovation Challenge
fields.shortDescription: A challenge in creating tech solutions addressing any of the 17 UN Sustainable Development Goals. Using AI/ML, apps, or hardware, students identify niche problems and design efficient systems to positively impact development criteria.
fields.longDescription:
" Global Goals, Local Code: An Innovation Challenge" The event will challenge participants to develop innovative, technology-based solutions addressing any of the 17 United Nations Sustainable Development Goals (SDGs). By focusing on globally recognized challenges and leveraging domains like AI/ML, web/app development, or hardware, this recognises technological innovation, and talent engagement.
Objective of the event: Students will be choosing one among the 17 SDG goals and identify niche areas and provide an efficient system or model that creates a positive impact on the development criteria.

fields.shortDescription: Hands on session for Mastering in Digital marketing techniques by building ideas to product.
fields.longDescription: Hands on session for Mastering in Digital marketing techniques by building ideas to product.

fields.shortDescription: A blend of cybersecurity and open-source learning through workshops, quizzes, overnight CTFs and showcases. It engages beginners and enthusiasts, fosters creativity and introduces students to inclusive FOSS and cybersecurity culture.
fields.longDescription:
Cyber 0 Day is a community-driven cybersecurity and open-source event that blends technical learning, problem-solving, and creativity. The event is designed to engage beginners and enthusiasts in hands-on workshops, a technical quiz, overnight Capture the Flag (CTF) challenges, and interactive showcases.
By combining technical depth with fun, collaborative activities, Cyber 0 Day aims to introduce younger students to cybersecurity and FOSS culture while fostering an inclusive, community-oriented environment that encourages peer-to-peer learning and open-source contributions.

fields.shortDescription: A 28-hour animation hackathon exploring 2D, 3D, stop motion, and multimedia. Teams conceptualize, produce, and pitch original projects. Event includes industry insights and concludes with judging on creativity, narrative, and technical execution.
fields.longDescription:
Animatathon is a 28-hour (or slightly shorter) hackathon-style event that celebrates the full spectrum of animation. Participants from diverse creative backgrounds will come together to explore and experiment with different forms of animation including 2D, 3D, stop motion, and multimedia. The event begins with a two-hour session led by a spokesperson, where industry insights and professional works will be shared to inspire and guide participants before they begin their projects.

Following this, teams will immerse themselves in an intensive creation phase, working to conceptualize and produce original animated projects within the given timeframe. From crafting characters and worlds to experimenting with techniques and storytelling, participants will push their creative boundaries. The event concludes with a showcase judged on creativity, narrative impact, and technical execution, making Animatathon both a competition and a collaborative platform to learn, innovate, and connect within the animation community.

fields.shortDescription: A 28-hour animation hackathon exploring 2D, 3D, stop motion, and multimedia. Teams conceptualize, produce, and pitch original projects. Event includes industry insights and concludes with judging on creativity, narrative, and technical execution.
fields.longDescription:
Animatathon is a 28-hour (or slightly shorter) hackathon-style event that celebrates the full spectrum of animation. Participants from diverse creative backgrounds will come together to explore and experiment with different forms of animation including 2D, 3D, stop motion, and multimedia. The event begins with a two-hour session led by a spokesperson, where industry insights and professional works will be shared to inspire and guide participants before they begin their projects.

Following this, teams will immerse themselves in an intensive creation phase, working to conceptualize and produce original animated projects within the given timeframe. From crafting characters and worlds to experimenting with techniques and storytelling, participants will push their creative boundaries. The event concludes with a showcase judged on creativity, narrative impact, and technical execution, making Animatathon both a competition and a collaborative platform to learn, innovate, and connect within the animation community.

fields.eventName: Create Autonomous AI with Open Source Ollama
fields.shortDescription: Workshop Title: Building Intelligent Agents with Ollama: A Practical Workshop Resource Person: Aishwarya Sundaresan – Lead Consultant @ Infosys | Executive MBA in Data Science & AI Description: Dive into the world of Agentic AI in this hands-on workshop designed for students, developers, and professionals eager to explore intelligent agents. Ollama is an advanced platform for building, managing, and deploying Agentic AI applications. It enables developers and AI enthusiasts to create intelligent agents that can perform autonomous tasks, make decisions, and interact with users or other systems. Under the guidance of Aishwarya Sundaresan, a leading AI consultant at Infosys, participants will gain practical experience in building, training, and deploying intelligent AI agents using the Ollama tool. The resource person has 14 years of digital transformation experience with a focus on meticulous technology implementation. Her journey in e-commerce consulting has honed a keen attention to detail and a strategic approach to business strategy, consistently driving growth and innovation. Her top skills include Solution Architecture , Digital Transformation, Large Language Models (LLM), Artificial Intelligence (AI). The resource person will provide hands-on training on Realtime E-commerce use cases. This workshop will cover: Fundamentals of Agentic AI and its real-world applications Step-by-step guidance on using Ollama for agent creation Hands-on exercises to design and deploy intelligent agents on Realtime E-commerce use cases Best practices for optimizing AI agent performance By the end of the session, participants will have a working understanding of how to create functional AI agents and leverage them for practical applications in business, research, and technology.
fields.longDescription:
Workshop Title: Building Intelligent Agents with Ollama: A Practical Workshop
Resource Person: Aishwarya Sundaresan – Lead Consultant @ Infosys | Executive MBA in Data Science & AI

Description:
Dive into the world of Agentic AI in this hands-on workshop designed for students, developers, and professionals eager to explore intelligent agents. Ollama is an advanced platform for building, managing, and deploying Agentic AI applications. It enables developers and AI enthusiasts to create intelligent agents that can perform autonomous tasks, make decisions, and interact with users or other systems. Under the guidance of Aishwarya Sundaresan, a leading AI consultant at Infosys, participants will gain practical experience in building, training, and deploying intelligent AI agents using the Ollama tool. The resource person has 14 years of digital transformation experience with a focus on meticulous technology implementation. Her journey in e-commerce consulting has honed a keen attention to detail and a strategic approach to business strategy, consistently driving growth and innovation. Her top skills include Solution Architecture , Digital Transformation, Large Language Models (LLM), Artificial Intelligence (AI). The resource person will provide hands-on training on Realtime E-commerce use cases.


This workshop will cover:

Fundamentals of Agentic AI and its real-world applications

Step-by-step guidance on using Ollama for agent creation

Hands-on exercises to design and deploy intelligent agents on Realtime E-commerce use cases

Best practices for optimizing AI agent performance

By the end of the session, participants will have a working understanding of how to create functional AI agents and leverage them for practical applications in business, research, and technology.

fields.shortDescription: Participants tackle two agriculture-focused challenges. DirectLink connects farmers to consumers for fair pricing and transparency. AgriBot builds AI chatbots offering crop guidance, weather updates, and market insights for rural communities.
fields.longDescription:
💻 Hackathon Problem Statement 1

Title: DirectLink: Producers to Consumers

Description:
Cut out the middleman, empower the farmer! In this hackathon challenge, you’ll design software solutions that connect producers directly with consumers, ensuring fair pricing, transparency, and trust. Build platforms, apps, or digital tools that revolutionize agri-markets and put power back into the hands of the growers. Innovation meets impact!


🤖 Hackathon Problem Statement 2

Title: AgriBot: Chat for Change

Description:
Bring AI to the fields! This challenge invites you to create a farmer-friendly chatbot that provides instant guidance — from crop care and weather updates to market trends and government schemes. Build a smart conversational assistant that’s simple, accessible, and impactful for rural communities. Let’s code solutions that speak the farmers’ language!

fields.shortDescription: A GenAI workshop featuring an interactive session by industry experts from ManageEngine (Zoho) on GenAI in security domains, followed by a hands-on session by students exploring general applications, industry use cases, and MCP server creation.
fields.longDescription: A genAI workshop starting with a interactive session by Industry people form ManageEngine (Zoho) on usage of genAI on securiy domains followed by a hands-on workshop from students on genAI of general use and for industry related usecases, MCP server creation, usecases.

fields.eventName: Cursor Create Your First Website in a Day
fields.shortDescription: Beginner-friendly workshop building a personal portfolio website with Cursor AI. Learn HTML/CSS, code with AI assistance, and create a fully customized site, ending with a showcase of participants’ completed projects.
fields.longDescription: “Cursor Create: Your First Website in a Day” is a beginner-friendly hands-on workshop where students will learn to build their very own personal portfolio website with the help of Cursor AI. Without needing prior coding experience, participants will explore the basics of HTML and CSS, see how AI can assist in writing and debugging code, and leave with a fully customized website they can proudly showcase on their resumes, LinkedIn, or GitHub. The event ends with a showcase round where students present their creations, making it both a learning and celebratory experience.

fields.eventName: One day Workshop on Agentic AI for Beginners
fields.shortDescription: Led by Aishwarya Sundaresan (Infosys), this hands-on workshop explores Agentic AI. Participants learn to build, train, and deploy intelligent agents on real-time e-commerce use cases using Ollama, gaining practical AI experience.
fields.longDescription:
Workshop Title: Building Intelligent Agents with Ollama: A Practical Workshop
Resource Person: Aishwarya Sundaresan – Lead Consultant @ Infosys | Executive MBA in Data Science & AI

Description:
Dive into the world of Agentic AI in this hands-on workshop designed for students, developers, and professionals eager to explore intelligent agents. Ollama is an advanced platform for building, managing, and deploying Agentic AI applications. It enables developers and AI enthusiasts to create intelligent agents that can perform autonomous tasks, make decisions, and interact with users or other systems. Under the guidance of Aishwarya Sundaresan, a leading AI consultant at Infosys, participants will gain practical experience in building, training, and deploying intelligent AI agents using the Ollama tool. The resource person has 14 years of digital transformation experience with a focus on meticulous technology implementation. Her journey in e-commerce consulting has honed a keen attention to detail and a strategic approach to business strategy, consistently driving growth and innovation. Her top skills include Solution Architecture , Digital Transformation, Large Language Models (LLM), Artificial Intelligence (AI). The resource person will provide hands-on training on Realtime E-commerce use cases.


This workshop will cover:

Fundamentals of Agentic AI and its real-world applications

Step-by-step guidance on using Ollama for agent creation

Hands-on exercises to design and deploy intelligent agents on Realtime E-commerce use cases

Best practices for optimizing AI agent performance

By the end of the session, participants will have a working understanding of how to create functional AI agents and leverage them for practical applications in business, research, and technology.

fields.shortDescription: "Game to Survive: Escape Room," a high-intensity challenge where physical puzzles and technical CTFs collide. The team of 2-3 will be trapped in a room filled with props and hidden clues, but the key to freedom lies in a central laptop terminal. The team must decipher physical hints from the surroundings to execute the correct commands, unlocking files and revealing the path forward. With only 30 minutes on the clock, the team must work together to solve every puzzle, master every game, and hack the way to victory
fields.longDescription: "Game to Survive: Escape Room," a high-intensity challenge where physical puzzles and technical CTFs collide. The team of 2-3 will be trapped in a room filled with props and hidden clues, but the key to freedom lies in a central laptop terminal. The team must decipher physical hints from the surroundings to execute the correct commands, unlocking files and revealing the path forward. With only 30 minutes on the clock, the team must work together to solve every puzzle, master every game, and hack the way to victory

fields.shortDescription: A SolidWorks/Fusion 360 event with a hands-on workshop on Day 1 and a design on Day 2. The 24 hr hackathon helps participants get the hang of CSWA & CSWP exam-taking, with a chance to win CSWA/CWSP coupons and a ₹10,000 cash prize pool.
fields.longDescription: A SolidWorks/Fusion 360 event with a hands-on workshop on Day 1 and a design on Day 2. The 24 hr hackathon helps participants get the hang of CSWA & CSWP exam-taking, with a chance to win CSWA/CWSP coupons and a ₹10,000 cash prize pool.

fields.shortDescription: Participants use leveling staff and basic surveying techniques to follow clues and find hidden checkpoints across campus. Each clue tests technical skills and teamwork, with the first team reaching the final treasure declared the winner.
fields.longDescription: An exciting twist to surveying! Participants will use leveling staff and basic surveying techniques to navigate clues and locate hidden checkpoints across the campus. Each clue leads to the next spot, testing both technical knowledge and teamwork. The team that finds the final treasure first wins the challenge.

fields.shortDescription: Get hands-on with the Internet of Things! This workshop introduces you to the world of ESP microcontrollers, where hardware meets innovation. Learn to program, connect, and build exciting projects using ESP boards, from smart devices to real-world automation. Whether you’re a beginner or a tinkerer, this is your chance to code, create, and craft the connected future.
fields.longDescription: Get hands-on with IoT using ESP microcontrollers! Learn to program, connect, and build projects from smart devices to automation. Beginners and tinkerers alike will code, create, and craft innovative, connected solutions for real-world applications.

fields.shortDescription: Join our workshop on smart gearboxes and their role in sustainability. Learn gear system basics, how innovations drive efficiency, and future trends. Led by Swaminathan T., an R&D expert with 10+ years of experience on defense and ISRO projects.
fields.longDescription: Join our workshop on smart gearboxes and their role in sustainability. Learn gear system basics, how innovations drive efficiency, and future trends. Led by Swaminathan T., an R&D expert with 10+ years of experience on defense and ISRO projects.

fields.shortDescription: Participants will join a Capture The Flag (CTF) competition featuring cryptography, web exploitation, reverse engineering, and forensics. This workshop-style event hones cybersecurity skills as teams race to capture flags and top the leaderboard.
fields.longDescription: In this event, participants will take part in a Capture The Flag (CTF) competition, solving challenges in areas like cryptography, web exploitation, reverse engineering, and forensics. The workshop-style setup will help participants sharpen their cybersecurity skills, and the competition format will make it engaging as teams race against time to capture the most flags and top the leaderboard.

fields.shortDescription: Participants will join a Capture The Flag (CTF) competition featuring cryptography, web exploitation, reverse engineering, and forensics. This workshop-style event hones cybersecurity skills as teams race to capture flags and top the leaderboard.

The workshop-style setup will help participants sharpen their cybersecurity skills, and the competition format will make it engaging as teams race against time to capture the most flags and top the leaderboard.

fields.eventName: Make Your Own Product CNC Machining
fields.shortDescription: Students will be gain exposure on CNC machining simulation. Hands-on session to use CNC lathe and Vertical Machining Centre to manufacture their own product. This would be beneficial for students interested to make their own product out of metals and special teams making components for their vehicles.
fields.longDescription: CNC machining workshop providing simulation and hands-on use of CNC lathe and vertical machining centers. Participants manufacture metal components, ideal for students creating custom parts for projects or vehicles

fields.shortDescription:
Event Rounds Description
Round 1: Campus Hunting
Participants will explore the campus to solve clues and find hidden locations. This round tests
observation, teamwork, and problem-solving skills. The fastest teams to complete the hunt will
move on to the next round.
Round 2: Debugging in Python
Participants will be given Python code snippets containing errors. The task is to debug and correct
the code within the given time limit. This round evaluates programming knowledge, logic, and
accuracy.
Round 3: Fun Games
This round will consist of 4 short and exciting fun games. They are designed to bring energy,
laughter, and friendly competition among participants. Performance in these games will also
contribute to overall scores.
Round 4: Balloon Pop Game
In the final round, balloons filled with chits containing riddles or tasks will be placed. Each team
pops a balloon and must solve the riddle or complete the task within the time limit. Correct answers
or successful attempts earn points. The team with the highest score at the end is declared the
winner. This round is fun, fast, and decisive.
fields.longDescription: Participants navigate a multi-round event: exploring the campus to solve clues, debugging Python code snippets, competing in fun games, and popping balloons with riddles or tasks. Teams earn points each round, and the highest scorer wins.

fields.shortDescription: A Star Wars–themed digital escape room where participants solve layers of puzzles (cryptography, codes, logic) to bypass Imperial security. Each level unlocks clues about the Death Star - mixing tech challenges with pop culture lore.
fields.longDescription: A Star Wars–themed digital escape room where participants solve layers of puzzles (cryptography, codes, logic) to bypass Imperial security. Each level unlocks clues about the Death Star - mixing tech challenges with pop culture lore.

fields.shortDescription: A Star Wars–themed digital escape room where participants solve layers of puzzles (cryptography, codes, logic) to bypass Imperial security. Each level unlocks clues about the Death Star - mixing tech challenges with pop culture lore.
fields.longDescription: A Star Wars–themed digital escape room where participants solve layers of puzzles (cryptography, codes, logic) to bypass Imperial security. Each level unlocks clues about the Death Star - mixing tech challenges with pop culture lore.

fields.eventName: Symmetria The Art and Math Exposition Trio
fields.shortDescription: Create visual or physical works from mathematical or data principles. Participants can generate algorithmic art, design geometric or 3D structures, or sonify datasets into music, combining creativity, math, and technical skills.
fields.longDescription:
Algorithmic Art: Generate stunning visual art using code, based on mathematical principles like fractals, tessellations, or parametric equations.

​Geometric Design: Design a physical or 3D-modeled structure (e.g., a bridge, a sculpture, an architectural model) that demonstrates advanced geometric principles and structural integrity.

Data Sonification: Transform a complex dataset into a musical composition, using mathematical rules to map data points to notes, rhythms, and harmonies.

fields.eventName: Symmetria The Art and Math Exposition Duo
fields.shortDescription: Create visual or physical works from mathematical or data principles. Participants can generate algorithmic art, design geometric or 3D structures, or sonify datasets into music, combining creativity, math, and technical skills.
fields.longDescription:
Algorithmic Art: Generate stunning visual art using code, based on mathematical principles like fractals, tessellations, or parametric equations.

​Geometric Design: Design a physical or 3D-modeled structure (e.g., a bridge, a sculpture, an architectural model) that demonstrates advanced geometric principles and structural integrity.

Data Sonification: Transform a complex dataset into a musical composition, using mathematical rules to map data points to notes, rhythms, and harmonies.

fields.shortDescription: Create visual or physical works from mathematical or data principles. Participants can generate algorithmic art, design geometric or 3D structures, or sonify datasets into music, combining creativity, math, and technical skills.

fields.shortDescription: Participants begin with a workshop on reinforcement learning, building and training models on AWS Deepracer. They then compete by racing their models for fastest lap times, applying their skills in an exciting, hands-on competition.
fields.longDescription: This event will begin with an interactive workshop where participants learn the fundamentals of reinforcement learning and get hands-on experience building and training their own models on AWS Deepracer. Following the workshop, participants will put their knowledge into action in an exciting competition, racing their trained models to achieve the fastest lap times and showcase their skills.

fields.shortDescription: Participants begin with a workshop on reinforcement learning, building and training models on AWS Deepracer. They then compete by racing their models for fastest lap times, applying their skills in an exciting, hands-on competition.
fields.longDescription: This event will begin with an interactive workshop where participants learn the fundamentals of reinforcement learning and get hands-on experience building and training their own models on AWS Deepracer. Following the workshop, participants will put their knowledge into action in an exciting competition, racing their trained models to achieve the fastest lap times and showcase their skills.

fields.shortDescription: Wolf of D Street on 30th Oct brings the stock market to campus. Students engage in simulations and challenges to learn investing, financial decisions, and sustainable economic growth, promoting financial literacy and aligning with SDG 8.
fields.longDescription:
Get ready to dive into the dynamic world of finance with Wolf of D Street, an exciting event that brings the thrill of the stock market to campus!
Happening on 30th October, this event aims to promote financial literacy among students and encourage smart, sustainable economic growth — aligning with SDG 8: Decent Work and Economic Growth.
Through engaging activities, simulations, and challenges, participants will get a hands-on experience of , investing, and making financial decisions — just like the real wolves of Dalal Street!

fields.shortDescription: Wolf of D Street on 30th Oct brings the stock market to campus. Students engage in simulations and challenges to learn investing, financial decisions, and sustainable economic growth, promoting financial literacy and aligning with SDG 8.

Through engaging activities, simulations, and challenges, participants will get a hands-on experience of , investing, and making financial decisions — just like the real wolves of Dalal Street!

fields.shortDescription: The two-day Startup Conclave inspires and guides students in entrepreneurship. Day 1 features interactive sessions with speakers sharing journeys and strategies. Day 2 focuses on startup pitches judged by experts, concluding with a prize distribution.
fields.longDescription:
The Startup Conclave is a two-day event focused on inspiring and guiding students in their entrepreneurial journeys.
Day 1: Innovation & Insight : This day will feature motivational and interactive sessions with three renowned speakers. They will share their personal stories of turning ideas into successful ventures, detailing the challenges, strategies, and key milestones they encountered.
Day 2 : Pitch : This day will focus on the practical application of entrepreneurial skills. Following two final speaker sessions, a dedicated startup pitching event will take place. This provides a platform for student startups to present their ideas to a panel of judges, investors, and industry experts. The event will culminate with a prize distribution ceremony to recognize and reward innovative ideas.

fields.shortDescription: CODYSSEY is a full-day Halloween coding showdown on 31st Oct. Participants solve algorithmic challenges, attend expert sessions, compete in coding sprints, enjoy themed activities, network, and win prizes, blending technical rigor with fun.
fields.longDescription:
CODYSSEY is a full-day competitive coding showdown on Halloween day, designed to challenge participants with algorithmic problem-solving, intense coding battles, and engaging technical sessions.
With a Halloween theme on 31st October, the event blends technical rigor with a creative, fun-filled atmosphere to make coding more thrilling than ever before.

Event Highlights
Competitive Coding Rounds – Multiple rounds of algorithmic and problem-solving challenges.
Speaker Session by Industry Expert – Gain insights from top professionals in the tech world.
Algorithmic Showdowns – Brainstorming puzzles and coding sprints with a twist.
Halloween-Themed Activities – Creative coding sessions and optional costume participation.
Networking Opportunities – Interact with peers, mentors, and sponsors.
Prizes, Swag, and PPIs – Rewards, goodies, and potential career opportunities.

fields.shortDescription: Business case competition with online prelims and offline finals. Teams solve interdisciplinary problems, present to judges including a BCG Principal, and participate in a panel discussion, developing analytical thinking and professional insight.
fields.longDescription: The "Catalyst Case Challenge" is a business case competition. It features an online preliminary round and an offline final for top teams. The event is structured to attract a diverse range of students from various academic fields by presenting a complex, interdisciplinary business problem. The final round will include live presentations and a Q&A session with a distinguished judging panel, including a Principal from Boston Consulting Group (BCG), and will be followed by a panel discussion.

fields.shortDescription: National Level - Project Display on Internet of Things with Apps
fields.longDescription: National Level - Project Display on Internet of Things with Apps

fields.shortDescription:
This hands-on workshop introduces participants to the fundamentals of soldering, an essential skill in electronics and hardware projects.
Attendees will learn the importance of soldering, types of solder and flux, safety practices, and the correct techniques to solder wires and electronic components. Through guided practice, participants will gain confidence in making reliable electrical connections and troubleshooting common mistakes.
Ideal for beginners and hobbyists, the session ensures a strong foundation in practical electronics assembly
fields.longDescription:
This hands-on workshop introduces participants to the fundamentals of soldering, an essential skill in electronics and hardware projects.
Attendees will learn the importance of soldering, types of solder and flux, safety practices, and the correct techniques to solder wires and electronic components. Through guided practice, participants will gain confidence in making reliable electrical connections and troubleshooting common mistakes.
Ideal for beginners and hobbyists, the session ensures a strong foundation in practical electronics assembly

fields.shortDescription: A healthcare entrepreneur is an innovator who develops and implements business solutions to improve medical services, patient care, or health technology. They combine medical insight with entrepreneurial skills to create impactful healthcare ventures
fields.longDescription: A healthcare entrepreneur is an innovator who develops and implements business solutions to improve medical services, patient care, or health technology. They combine medical insight with entrepreneurial skills to create impactful healthcare ventures

fields.shortDescription: Gear up for the Road Rash event, where participants build their own RC cars and then battle it out on a rugged dirt track. Put your creativity, engineering skills, and driving control to the test as custom-built machines race over bumps, ramps, and sharp turns for the championship.
fields.longDescription: Gear up for the Road Rash event, where participants build their own RC cars and then battle it out on a rugged dirt track. Put your creativity, engineering skills, and driving control to the test as custom-built machines race over bumps, ramps, and sharp turns for the championship.

fields.shortDescription: The teams have to train a model that will perform best for the given dataset, the event will have 2 rounds, 1st round will be to familiarize the teams and will of carry minimum weightage and the second round will carry the rest of the points and based on metrics for the ML model the winner will be chosen
fields.longDescription: The teams have to train a model that will perform best for the given dataset, the event will have 2 rounds, 1st round will be to familiarize the teams and will of carry minimum weightage and the second round will carry the rest of the points and based on metrics for the ML model the winner will be chosen

fields.shortDescription: Teams of 3 get a fixed budget to build a bridge and load-bearing structure. Completing mini-challenges earns extra materials. Participants must optimize resources, time, and construction strategy to create the strongest, most efficient structure
fields.longDescription: we provide each participating team with a fixed budget, which they can spend on materials that we have in store and use to build a bridge to cross a gap and a structure that can take the maximum load. Participants are also given a chance to complete some small challenges to get more budget for materials. They now must optimize time spent on challenges materials and the time spent on constructing the bridge . Team of 3 will take on this challenge

fields.shortDescription: Teams of 3 get a fixed budget to build a bridge and load-bearing structure. Completing mini-challenges earns extra materials. Participants must optimize resources, time, and construction strategy to create the strongest, most efficient structure

fields.shortDescription: Hands-on Raspberry Pi + ML workshop. Deploy lightweight ML models on edge devices, explore IoT applications, and build sensor-driven ML demos in resource-constrained environments.
fields.longDescription:
RasPi Meets ML
This event brings together the power of Raspberry Pi with the intelligence of Machine Learning. Participants will explore how low-cost, versatile Raspberry Pi boards can serve as platforms for building real-world ML applications at the edge. Through hands-on sessions and demonstrations, the event will cover topics such as:

Fundamentals of Raspberry Pi for AI/ML projects

Deploying lightweight ML models on edge devices

Related Applications in IoT
Practical demos showcasing sensor-based ML algorithms

Designed for students, researchers, the event aims to bridge the gap between embedded systems and machine learning, fostering innovation in resource-constrained environments.

fields.shortDescription: Participants transform initial sketches into fully functional apps/websites addressing real-world problems. Teams design, develop and pitch solutions, judged on innovation, functionality, usability, and presentation.
fields.longDescription:
Sketch2Stage will be an event organized by Hack Club, designed to inspire creativity, innovation, and problem-solving among students. This event challenges participants to transform their initial ideas the “sketch” into fully functional digital solutions and pitch it on “stage”
Participants will be presented with a set of real-world problem statements and will have a fixed time to design and develop an app or website particularly the design and user experience that addresses these challenges. The event emphasizes not just technical skills, but also innovation, usability, and the ability to communicate ideas effectively.
Once development concludes, teams will get the opportunity to pitch their solutions to a panel of judges. The pitch is a crucial part of the competition, allowing participants to showcase their product’s features, the problem it solves, and their vision for impact.
Winners will be selected based on criteria such as originality, relevance to the problem statement, functionality, user experience, and presentation skills.
Sketch2Stage will allow students to gain hands-on experience in product development, learn to work collaboratively under deadlines, and enhance their pitching and presentation abilities all while competing in a fun, energetic, and innovation-driven environment.

fields.shortDescription: Survival simulation on a sinking ship. Participants assume corporate roles and must persuade why their role is critical for survival and rebuilding society, testing creativity, logic, and debate. The audience and judges decide who makes it into the lifeboat.
fields.longDescription:
“Shipwreck” is an engaging and thought-provoking event where participants are placed in a survival scenario aboard a sinking ship. Each participant is assigned a corporate role (e.g., Data Analyst, Marketing Head, AI Specialist, UI/UX Designer, HR Manager, Finance Lead, etc.). When the ship begins to sink, there is only one spot left in the lifeboat. Each participant must pitch and defend their case on why their role is the most critical for survival and the future rebuilding of society.
This event tests persuasion, creativity, roleplay skills, and logical reasoning. The audience and judges decide who makes it into the lifeboat.

fields.shortDescription: 2 day Workshop starting from installation of ROS to basics of SLAM
fields.longDescription: 2 day Workshop starting from installation of ROS to basics of SLAM

fields.shortDescription: A one-day Game Jam where teams of 1–4 design and build playable games from scratch. Kickoff introduces theme and rules, followed by brainstorming, development, mentor guidance, and final demos. Awards are given for creativity, execution, and polish.
fields.longDescription:
A one-day intensive Game Jam where participants design and build playable games from scratch.
Kickoff reveals the theme and rules, followed by brainstorming and planning sessions.
Teams develop core mechanics, polish visuals, and integrate sound within set blocks.
Mentors provide technical guidance; progress is checked mid-event.
Final demos are showcased, with feedback and awards for creativity and execution.

Team size: 1-4 members

fields.shortDescription: Competitive programming round where participants will be solving cp questions and the top 3 will be awarded

fields.shortDescription: Competitive coding tournament where participants solve progressively harder problems, testing logic, speed, and problem-solving. Teams climb the leaderboard through multiple rounds, with only the sharpest coders advancing and prevailing.
fields.longDescription: Decodex is an electrifying competitive coding tournament where sharp minds battle through rounds of challenging problems. Test your logic, speed, and problem-solving skills as you climb the leaderboard. With each stage tougher than the last, only the best coders will prevail. Code. Compete. Conquer.

fields.shortDescription: Design the Device is a workshop to help students understand the basics of semiconductor device simulation. It gives a simple introduction to how TCAD tools are used in research and industry for designing and analyzing electronic devices.
fields.longDescription: Design the Device is a workshop to help students understand the basics of semiconductor device simulation. It gives a simple introduction to how TCAD tools are used in research and industry for designing and analyzing electronic devices.

fields.shortDescription: Trade of Titans – Event Summary Trade of Titans is a technology-driven economic strategy simulation where teams act as countries in a structured trade ecosystem. Each team starts with defined resources and virtual currency, then engages in multiple rounds of barter and monetary trade to balance imports, exports, and deficits. The event is highly technical, integrating: Data analysis & quantitative reasoning – interpreting trade values, price volatility, and optimization of resource balance. Game theory & strategy design – crafting competitive/cooperative negotiation strategies under uncertainty. Algorithmic thinking – designing heuristics, decision trees, and computational models for trade decisions. Tech-enabled simulation – using digital tools, dashboards, or simulators to model dynamic markets and respond to shocks in real time. Alongside technical skills, participants must also demonstrate strategic communication and fast-paced decision-making. This makes the event not just about negotiation but about applying computational strategy, optimization, and algorithmic reasoning in a competitive, simulation-based environment.
fields.longDescription:
Trade of Titans – Event Summary

Trade of Titans is a technology-driven economic strategy simulation where teams act as countries in a structured trade ecosystem. Each team starts with defined resources and virtual currency, then engages in multiple rounds of barter and monetary trade to balance imports, exports, and deficits.

The event is highly technical, integrating:

Data analysis & quantitative reasoning – interpreting trade values, price volatility, and optimization of resource balance.

Game theory & strategy design – crafting competitive/cooperative negotiation strategies under uncertainty.

Algorithmic thinking – designing heuristics, decision trees, and computational models for trade decisions.

Tech-enabled simulation – using digital tools, dashboards, or simulators to model dynamic markets and respond to shocks in real time.

Alongside technical skills, participants must also demonstrate strategic communication and fast-paced decision-making. This makes the event not just about negotiation but about applying computational strategy, optimization, and algorithmic reasoning in a competitive, simulation-based environment.

fields.shortDescription: One-day analytics challenge testing web scraping, dashboard creation, and data storytelling. Participants transform raw data into insights within hours and present findings for evaluation in a fast-paced environment.
fields.longDescription:
We are excited to propose “Insight Sprint: The Data Dive Challenge”, a 1-day analytics showdown designed to test participants’ skills in web scraping, dashboard creation, and data storytelling. The event is built around the theme “From Raw Data to Real Insights in Just 4 Hours”, creating a dynamic platform for data enthusiasts to showcase their talent under real-world time pressure.

📅 Event Timeline (9:00 AM – 1:00 PM)
09:00 – 09:30 AM | Inauguration & Briefing

09:30 – 10:45 AM | Web Scraping Challenge

10:45 – 11:45 AM | Dashboard Creation Round

11:45 – 12:30 PM | Data Storytelling & Final Presentations

12:30 – 01:00 PM | Evaluation, Results & Closing Remarks

fields.shortDescription: We'll get hydrogen alpha telescope to enable students to watch the sun, sunspots, solar flares etc. Along with this we'll also teach people how to operate a telescope.
fields.longDescription: We'll get hydrogen alpha telescope to enable students to watch the sun, sunspots, solar flares etc. Along with this we'll also teach people how to operate a telescope.

fields.shortDescription: Participants will be trained about aerial surveying using surveying drone including field surveys and post processing works in topographic map preparation
fields.longDescription: Participants will be trained about aerial surveying using surveying drone including field surveys and post processing works in topographic map preparation

fields.eventName: Personal Finance Workshop for Young Adults
fields.shortDescription: A 4–5 hour interactive workshop for 18–23-year-olds covering budgeting, cash flow, banking, CIBIL scores, SIPs, mutual funds, taxes, and insurance. Hands-on exercises and a 30-day action plan help build financial skills, habits, and independence.
fields.longDescription:
The Personal Finance Workshop for Young Adults is a 4–5 hour interactive session designed to equip students and early-career individuals (ages 18–23) with essential money-management skills that schools and colleges often overlook. Through engaging activities, games, and practical worksheets, participants will learn how to budget effectively, manage cash flow, understand banking and digital finance in India, build and improve their CIBIL scores, explore beginner-friendly investment options like SIPs and mutual funds, and grasp the basics of taxation and insurance. The workshop also focuses on developing positive financial habits, with a 30-day action plan to put concepts into practice. By the end, attendees will gain not just financial knowledge but also actionable strategies, confidence, and a clear roadmap to take charge of their money and build long-term financial independence.

https://docs.google.com/document/d/1Vin4m2pyALK8fzGnrhsA4E63QgTHQiNn/edit?usp=sharing&ouid=110921576229861351143&rtpof=true&sd=true

fields.shortDescription: Process Planning Game: Teams act as process engineers building mini production plants using blocks with varied speeds, costs, and reliability. Output is simulated live; teams face breakdowns/market changes. Judged on efficiency, cost, output, adaptability, creativity, teamwork.
fields.longDescription: This event revolves around the concept of process planning, which is the first step to any workflow in an industry. Participants will be split into teams where they will play the role of process engineers tasked with designing their own mini production plant within a stipulated time. They will receive a set of process blocks (mixers, conveyors, heaters, packaging units, etc.), each with different speeds, costs, and reliability ratings, and must arrange them to create the most efficient and cost-effective production line possible. Once teams finalize their plant layouts, their production output will be simulated live and a leaderboard will be displayed. Participants will also be challenged with random breakdowns or market changes, forcing them to skillfully reconfigure their design under time pressure. Judging will be based on efficiency of plant layout, cost optimization, output performance, adaptability under challenges, creativity in design, and teamwork/presentation. This game aims to simulate a practical and realistic work environment for the same and equip the students with knowledge on how things really work in an industry, while also keeping entertaining and lighthearted. This gamified version of process planning aligns with AutoVIT’s scope of industrial automation where process planning is a key step, and also teaches students in a way where they have fun and enjoy learning.

fields.shortDescription: Debug the Drama is a team event where one member gets a secret movie or phrase and uses AI to create an image with visual clues. The team then guesses the answer within the time limit—faster guesses earn more points. The team with the highest score wins.
fields.longDescription: Debug the Drama is a team event where one member gets a secret movie or phrase and uses AI to create an image with visual clues. The team then guesses the answer within the time limit—faster guesses earn more points. The team with the highest score wins.

fields.shortDescription: Workshop on video editing fundamentals. Learn cuts, transitions, and effects to transform raw footage into polished, cinematic sequences. Ideal for beginners and aspiring editors wanting practical, hands-on experience.
fields.longDescription: Every great movie is made in the editing room. This workshop teaches you the magic behind cuts, transitions, and effects that turn raw footage into cinematic brilliance. From beginners learning their first montage to budding editors polishing their craft, this is your ticket to becoming the editor every director dreams of.

fields.shortDescription: Teams manage a real-world civil engineering project with limited resources, preparing an optimized budget balancing quality, cost, and feasibility. The most practical and efficient plan wins, testing planning, strategy, and decision-making skills.
fields.longDescription: Test your planning and management skills! In this event, participants will be given a real-world civil engineering project scenario along with limited resources and constraints. The task is to prepare an efficient budget plan that balances quality, cost, and feasibility. The team with the most practical and optimized budget wins.

fields.clubName: VOICE-IT VIT CHENNAI'S RADIO X IEEE Compsoc
fields.shortDescription: A two-day ideathon where students decode challenges from 5–7 industry partners. Day 1: treasure hunt to uncover problem statements. Day 2: develop and pitch solutions with mentor guidance, evaluated on innovation, clarity, and creativity.
fields.longDescription:
404: Clue Not Found – by Voice-IT for TechnoVIT 2025 
 
 404: Clue Not Found is a two-day ideathon–solvathon organized as part of TechnoVIT 2025 at VIT Chennai. The event connects students with real-world challenges from 5–7 industry partners across sectors such as technology, healthcare, transport, finance and sustainability.
 
 Day 1: Discovering the Challenges.
 Participants begin with a treasure hunt that involves decoding personas, solving clues, and uncovering problem statements. This gamified approach helps students engage with industry challenges in an interactive and collaborative way.
 
 Day 2: Developing and Pitching Solutions.
 With guidance from industry mentors, student teams work on the identified problems—brainstorming ideas, refining concepts, and preparing their pitches. The event emphasizes not only the strength of the solutions but also the clarity, creativity, and persuasiveness of how they are presented. Teams are evaluated on both innovation and communication, mirroring real-world expectations where ideas must be both effective and well-delivered.

fields.shortDescription: 24-hour online hackathon where participants design innovative, user-centered UIs for platforms promoting environmental sustainability. Challenges focus on UN SDGs like climate action, circular economy, resource management and green mobility solutions.
fields.longDescription: DesignSprint is an intensive 24-hour online hackathon that challenges participants to create innovative, user-centered interfaces for platforms promoting environmental sustainability and responsible practices. This virtual event brings together designers, developers, and sustainability enthusiasts to tackle real-world problems through thoughtful UI/UX design. Participants must design a functional and user-friendly UI for a digital platform that directly supports UN Sustainable Development Goals (SDGs) or environmental sustainability practices. Challenge areas include climate action platforms, circular economy applications, sustainable consumption tools, resource management dashboards, food security systems, or green mobility solutions.
rules: Designs must be original and created using approved tools (Figma, XD, Sketch, etc.). Submit design files, screenshots, and a short pitch deck before the strict deadline. Late or copied entries are disqualified.

fields.shortDescription: 24-hour online hackathon where participants design innovative, user-centered UIs for platforms promoting environmental sustainability. Challenges focus on UN SDGs like climate action, circular economy, resource management and green mobility solutions.
fields.longDescription: DesignSprint is an intensive 24-hour online hackathon that challenges participants to create innovative, user-centered interfaces for platforms promoting environmental sustainability and responsible practices. This virtual event brings together designers, developers, and sustainability enthusiasts to tackle real-world problems through thoughtful UI/UX design. Participants must design a functional and user-friendly UI for a digital platform that directly supports UN Sustainable Development Goals (SDGs) or environmental sustainability practices. Challenge areas include climate action platforms, circular economy applications, sustainable consumption tools, resource management dashboards, food security systems, or green mobility solutions.
rules: Designs must be original and created using approved tools (Figma, XD, Sketch, etc.). Submit design files, screenshots, and a short pitch deck before the strict deadline. Late or copied entries are disqualified.

fields.eventName: Workshop on Agentic AI for Beginners:Autonomous AI with Open-Source Ollama
fields.shortDescription: Led by Aishwarya Sundaresan (Infosys), this hands-on workshop explores Agentic AI. Participants learn to build, train, and deploy intelligent agents on real-time e-commerce use cases using Ollama, gaining practical AI experience.
fields.longDescription:
Workshop Title: Building Intelligent Agents with Ollama: A Practical Workshop
Resource Person: Aishwarya Sundaresan – Lead Consultant @ Infosys | Executive MBA in Data Science & AI

Description:
Dive into the world of Agentic AI in this hands-on workshop designed for students, developers, and professionals eager to explore intelligent agents. Ollama is an advanced platform for building, managing, and deploying Agentic AI applications. It enables developers and AI enthusiasts to create intelligent agents that can perform autonomous tasks, make decisions, and interact with users or other systems. Under the guidance of Aishwarya Sundaresan, a leading AI consultant at Infosys, participants will gain practical experience in building, training, and deploying intelligent AI agents using the Ollama tool. The resource person has 14 years of digital transformation experience with a focus on meticulous technology implementation. Her journey in e-commerce consulting has honed a keen attention to detail and a strategic approach to business strategy, consistently driving growth and innovation. Her top skills include Solution Architecture , Digital Transformation, Large Language Models (LLM), Artificial Intelligence (AI). The resource person will provide hands-on training on Realtime E-commerce use cases.


This workshop will cover:

Fundamentals of Agentic AI and its real-world applications

Step-by-step guidance on using Ollama for agent creation

Hands-on exercises to design and deploy intelligent agents on Realtime E-commerce use cases

Best practices for optimizing AI agent performance

By the end of the session, participants will have a working understanding of how to create functional AI agents and leverage them for practical applications in business, research, and technology.
rules: Register in advance and attend fully for a certificate. Basic Python/AI knowledge preferred. Bring a laptop with internet and install Ollama if needed. Participate actively, respect others, and don’t share materials. Be punctual to avoid missing key parts.

fields.shortDescription: Quiz-based competition testing tech knowledge, problem-solving, and emerging technology awareness. Teams answer progressively challenging questions, fostering collaboration, quick thinking, and competitive spirit.
fields.longDescription: Brainware is an exciting quiz-based competition that brings a technological twist to the classic Kaun Banega Crorepati format. Participants will tackle rounds of progressively challenging questions spanning computer science, emerging technologies, logical problem-solving, and general tech knowledge. The event is designed to test technical expertise, quick thinking, and strategic decision-making in an engaging and competitive setup. Scheduled to be held on any one day of TechnoVIT, with a maximum team size of 2 members, Brainware promotes collaboration and knowledge sharing, making it a fun, intellectually stimulating highlight of TechnoVIT.

 Small, quick challenges like:
 Stack bricks fastest without falling.

 Fun, lighthearted, yet relevant.

fields.eventName: Next-Gen Talent with AI: HireAbility Workshop
fields.shortDescription: Hire-Ability Lab gets you future-ready — sharpening how you think, solve, and break problems down from first principles. It’s about mindset to tackle challenges and skills to land the job
fields.longDescription: Hire-Ability Lab gets you future-ready — sharpening how you think, solve, and break problems down from first principles. It’s about mindset to tackle challenges and skills to land the job

fields.shortDescription: Participants begin with a workshop on reinforcement learning, building and training models on AWS Deepracer. They then compete by racing their models for fastest lap times, applying their skills in an exciting, hands-on competition.
fields.longDescription: This event will begin with an interactive workshop where participants learn the fundamentals of reinforcement learning and get hands-on experience building and training their own models on AWS Deepracer. Following the workshop, participants will put their knowledge into action in an exciting competition, racing their trained models to achieve the fastest lap times and showcase their skills.

fields.shortDescription: In this on-campus digital treasure hunt, teams of 1-4 will learn Open Source Intelligence (OSINT). Follow online and offline clues using cybersecurity skills to reach a finale where your choices determine how you find a missing person.
fields.longDescription:
An engaging, on-campus digital treasure hunt designed to introduce participants to Open Source Intelligence (OSINT) techniques through a mix of real-world investigation and cybersecurity puzzles. Starting from a physical location within the college, participants follow clues that take them on various online and offline trails involving web research, digital footprints, and hidden leads. All paths lead to a thrilling three-way finale where participants’ choices determine how they find a missing person. This event provides students with a fun, interactive way to build foundational OSINT and cybersecurity skills while offering management a well-rounded, technically relevant learning experience.
 
 Team size: 1-4

fields.shortDescription: Fly drones in a realistic simulation using actual remote controllers. Participants will navigate virtual challenges, testing piloting skills in a safe environment linked to aerospace, control systems, and simulation engineering.
fields.longDescription: Fly drones in a realistic simulation using actual remote controllers. Participants will navigate virtual challenges, testing their piloting skills in a safe environment. The event connects to the technical domain through aerospace, control systems, and simulation engineering, showcasing real-world applications of drones in logistics, defense, and surveying.

fields.shortDescription: In this challenge, teams of 2 have 45 minutes to build a catapult using only provided materials. The objective is to launch projectiles and knock down targets. Points are awarded for accuracy, power, and creative design, with penalties for delays.
fields.longDescription:
The Angry Bird Stem event is a hands-on building and targeting challenge. 
 Objective: Participants must design and build a miniature catapult that can launch projectiles to knock down the target. Accuracy and distance both matter.
 Competition: Team of 2 people. All the teams compete with each other. Each and every team will be given 45 mins to build and design their own catapult and launch. Points will be awarded for hitting the target, knocking them down, creative design and if they do not finish it on time their points will be reduced. The team with the highest score or fastest completion wins.
 Rules: Participants can only use the materials provided by the club. Creativity in building and designing the catapult is encouraged. Safety must be maintained while launching projectiles

fields.shortDescription: Animatathon is a hackathon for creators in 2D, 3D, and stop-motion animation. The event starts with a 2-hour industry talk, followed by a team creation phase. It concludes with a showcase judged on creativity, narrative, and technical execution.
fields.longDescription:
Animatathon is a 28-hour (or slightly shorter) hackathon-style event that celebrates the full spectrum of animation. Participants from diverse creative backgrounds will come together to explore and experiment with different forms of animation including 2D, 3D, stop motion, and multimedia. The event begins with a two-hour session led by a spokesperson, where industry insights and professional works will be shared to inspire and guide participants before they begin their projects.
 
 Following this, teams will immerse themselves in an intensive creation phase, working to conceptualize and produce original animated projects within the given timeframe. From crafting characters and worlds to experimenting with techniques and storytelling, participants will push their creative boundaries. The event concludes with a showcase judged on creativity, narrative impact, and technical execution, making Animatathon both a competition and a collaborative platform to learn, innovate, and connect within the animation community.

fields.shortDescription:
Choose your challenge!
Algorithmic Art: Generate visual art from code using mathematical principles.
Geometric Design: Design a 3D structure demonstrating advanced geometry.
Data Sonification: Transform a dataset into a musical composition.
fields.longDescription:
Algorithmic Art: Generate stunning visual art using code, based on mathematical principles like fractals, tessellations, or parametric equations.
 
 ​Geometric Design: Design a physical or 3D-modeled structure (e.g., a bridge, a sculpture, an architectural model) that demonstrates advanced geometric principles and structural integrity.
 
 Data Sonification: Transform a complex dataset into a musical composition, using mathematical rules to map data points to notes, rhythms, and harmonies.

fields.shortDescription: Interactive event designed to teach participants the practical skills of designing and fabricating electronic circuits on PCB platforms.
fields.longDescription: Interactive event designed to teach participants the practical skills of designing and fabricating electronic circuits on PCB platforms.

fields.shortDescription: Hands-on Figma workshop: learn wireframes, mockups, prototypes, then design a complete UI. Win cash prizes, certificates for all.
fields.longDescription: Hands-on Figma workshop: learn wireframes, mockups, prototypes, then design a complete UI. Win cash prizes, certificates for all.

fields.shortDescription: Participants will join a Capture The Flag (CTF) contest with cryptography, web, reverse engineering, and forensics challenges, sharpening cybersecurity skills as teams race to capture flags and lead the leaderboard.
fields.longDescription: Participants will join a Capture The Flag (CTF) competition featuring cryptography, web exploitation, reverse engineering, and forensics. This workshop-style event hones cybersecurity skills as teams race to capture flags and top the leaderboard.
